headline: Best Soft Christmas Cookies
description: This Christmas cookie recipe makes soft, tender sugar cutouts that hold their shape. Sprinkle with colored sugar before baking or frost when cool.

video.description: Buttery sugar cookies perfect for the holidays or any occasion.
video.name: Soft Christmas Cookies

name: Best Soft Christmas Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Sift flour, baking powder, and salt together in a medium bowl; set aside.

Beat sugar and margarine in a large bowl with an electric mixer until smooth. Beat first egg into butter mixture. Beat second egg into mixture along with vanilla extract; add flour mixture and stir until dough is just combined. Wrap dough; chill in the refrigerator for 2 hours.
Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease two cookie sheets.
Roll out dough on a clean floured surface to 1/4-inch thickness. Cut out shapes using cookie cutters; arrange them on the prepared cookie sheets. Gather scraps and repeat this step.
Bake in batches in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 6 to 8 minutes. Cool on the baking sheet briefly before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

review.reviewBody: Whomever made up this recipient has made me the only cookie maker in the family. Minor substitutes as others made and just amazing. I love it, thank you
Turned out great but after reading the reviews I did make a few changes. I added almond, used butter, cut back the flour and lowered the baking temp. Will make this again with the adjustments.
This is an outstanding recipe. The only thing I did different was use butter.
Verrrrry noisüëçüòò
Love it!
Best recipe going... Reduced flour to 3 1/4 cups.... Rave reviews from all!
love it

It was not as soft as I wanted, but it was still good. I would make it again if I could not find a better soft-cut-out cookie. It was super easy and I would recommend it to someone trying to make an easy cookie to decorate.
I liked them
I love this recipe...it works every time...and it's flawless
This is a quick easy cookie, I added some cinnamon for some additional flavor. Just 'cause I like cinnamon. Thx.
Really good cookies

Way too much flour. Following the directions exactly will leave you with a dry, crumbly, very bland, mess. I ended up adding melted butter at the end just to make it workable. Next time I‚Äôll be tweaking the recipe

These are just ok. I did what one reviewer suggested and used half brown sugar and added some molasses, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Maybe I got the proportions wrong, but these were nothing to write home about.
These are not "SOFT" cookies. I followed the instructions except I used butter instead of margarine.
Used 3 cups of flour and butter instead of margarine. Loved them!
Excellent but add did obscure some of it. Has to go back and fill in missing words.
Super easy

I've used many different sugar cookie recipes over the years. This one is my favorite that I will use from now on. I used butter in place of the margarine. These cookies hold up well - mine were left out overnight for icing to dry, and then frozen and thawed twice, and shipped across the country! After more than two weeks, they are still delicious! I used the Sugar Cookie Icing from this site, and they've just been the best cookies I've made to date!

Really misleading, more like guidelines than anything else. I don't know how anyone could have made this recipe without changing it. It calls for way too much flour. I didn't even bother with the margarine, and used butter. I wish I had read more of the comments before making it. That's what I get for not listening to my gut when I saw how much flour it asked for! The dough even after chilling was like dust dry, I couldn't even roll it into balls without them falling apart! Let alone roll it out to cut shapes in. Dang shame.
Very easy to work with, very tasty. Not too sweet, so will work with any icing, sugars, etc., that you chose to use to decorate. Can be rolled a little thinner than 1/4".
After I put it in the fridge, I took it out and it was crumbly and dry. I added some milk and it became doughy (Just like what I wanted)
They are super easy to make. Instructions were very clear. My first attempt at making sugar cookies so I‚Äôm happy. Thanks

I tried this recipe to see if it was better than the one I had been using. Sadly it is not. I followed the recipe. The dough was a bit crumbly but once it warmed up a bit it rolled just fine. They cut out ok. Not great because of the crumbly dough but ok. I baked the first batch at 400¬∞ for 8 minutes. Over done. Cut it down to 6 minutes. The thinner cookies were still too brown. Thicker ones were just right. Thin cookies were hard. Thicker cookies were softer but not truly soft. Ok so that brings me to taste. These are almost tasteless. So bland, not even a butter taste! Overall I am not impressed with this recipe.
To put it plainly it was awful. Awful taste, look everything. Would not recommend at all. I am never making recipes from here anymore.
Best soft sugar cookie recipe ever! I always get asked for the recipe!
They were delicious
Reduced flour to 3 cups as per suggestions and added a small amount of pumpkin pie spice. So good! Easy to roll and tasty.
Great recipe. I make these several times a year
Turned out great! This was the first time making these with icing, but were an awesome recipe!!

Wow! Im keeping this recipe for life. Everyone loved the cookies. People are asking me to bake more. I added over 3tbs milk when the dough was too dry and extra 2tbs butter. 
Thank you and happy new year!
I think it was wonderful. it was easy to make.
Very good
These cookies are just as hard as every other roll out sugar cookie.
These were pretty simple to make and came out nice. If youre going to ice it, however, definitely cut down the sugar.

These are the BEST cutout cookies I have ever had! Most years, cutouts are pretty but don‚Äôt taste great. These are amazing. I followed others mods and used 3 cups flour. Made sure they were not too thin although I made a couple too thick and they are enormous. Used 1 tsp of lemon extract in addition to the vanilla and brushed them with a lemon glaze (butter, lemon juice, powdered sugar) and then decorated them. Beautiful and tasty!!
Love this recipe for holiday cookies! They simple to make and take on almond or rum extract very nicely.
Nice and soft cookies. Take them out at 8 min or less. Otherwise they get hard.

Turned out perfect. I made one change to the recipe by substituting half the vanilla for almond extract. The cookies turned out hard than I excepted after cooling but it was fine and they taste delicious.

With minor change of using butter instead of margarine, and melting it before creaming with the sugar. And using 3 cups of flour, and oven at 350 degrees for 8-10 mins....perfection! This dough was moist, but not sticky. Very smooth to roll out and baked beautifully. Great with the minor modifications!
Perfect for cut out cookies. Easy to roll and kept their shape without expanding. This will be my new go to recipe.

Very tasty. I followed the advice of others using only 3 cups of flour, using butter instead of margarine and rolling out to approx 1/4". They turned out perfectly. My cookie monster husband loved them.

I made this recipe and it turned out really good and I made my own frosting but instead of margine I used butter it makes a better texture and my kids loved it and my 4 year old put 2 cookies for santa

We (myself, my 15yr old boy, 14yr old girl and headed by my 10yr old boy) had a great time making these! Fist batch we over cooked a bit, not burned but not soft...at 8min at 400F so then we reduced time to 6min each time cured that. FYI We are in Colorado with a Bosch oven. I think 8 was too long for the fist batch but might have been perfect for the rest of the batches since the oven lost heat each time it was opened....the taste is perfect. Now we‚Äôre excited for the decorating!
I followed the advise of other reviewers and cut the flower to 3 cups and lowered the oven temp to 375. The cookies turned out great. This is a solid recipe for cookie cutters and iced cookies.

This turned out really great but I gave it 4 stars because of some adjustments needed. As others mentioned, I too only used 3 cups of flour and additional flour as needed for rolling. Also I cooked it at 375 for about 8 mins and they turned out well. It‚Äôs true, you need to make sure not to roll them too thin or bake them too long. What I really loved about these cookies is that they are NOT overly sweet so they pair really well with an sugary icing when you decorate them.
These cookies are exemplary! I love how soft and delicious they are!
I have been using this recipe for many years. I have tried several other recipes but nothing quite compare to this one. I always come back to this. I do agree, 3c. of flour is a good adjustment.
I reduced the flour to 3 1/4 cups, they came out perfect from the cookie cutters.
Made it with young kids and they loved doing the cookie cutting. It was easy and tasted great.
These cookies turned out perfectly! They‚Äôre great on their own, with sprinkles or with icing. Very versatile!! I will be using this recipe whenever I make sugar cookies in the future!!

I'm a thirteen year-old and christmas is coming in like, JUST A FEW DAYS!! I'm really excited so I was just browsing through google and I just HAPPENED to come here and I thought, santa needs something to eat when he comes and I was all like, YES THIS IS WHAT I NEED!!! I've not been taught how to cook or bake or whatever but this recipe is SO simple, so everyone, I suggest this HIGHER THAN HIGHLY because I could do it alone without any help
Best tasting sugar cookies yet!
No changes, but I made them the day before. Freaked out because the dough was so hard. But microwaved a little at a time for 15 sec and worked out great! Tasted great without frosting!
These make the best sugar cookies. We've used this recipe that past 5 or so years and had a lot of success!
These cookies always are fantastic. Everyone I make them for lives them!!
Great recipe, I substituted w butter and used 3 cups of sugar baked at 350 degrees and they came out great
I really loved these cookies, this was a really nice and simple recipie. I adjusted a bit but they came out perfect :) This is a fun activity, just need patience, love and make sure to have fun.
I used butter instead of margarine. They turned out great!

I added 3 cups of flour and used softened butter, not melted. I used a ruler to make sure it was rolled 1/4 inch thick, then cut them out and baked at 350 for exactly 8 minutes and decorated with royal icing. They were so soft.
Wasn't very happy with these. They had more of a flour taste instead of shortbread or sugar cookie. And was looking for a softer cookie
Baked for the first time with these, turned out really well.
Awesome recipe doesn‚Äôt take long to make I will make these again I did add cinnamon in them
Loved it!!! But ours turned out crunchy.

I have been using this recipe for YEARS and we love it! Makes a very nice, not too sweet, cookie. I will echo what others have said - I only use 3 cups of flour, they get plenty when flouring the counter/rolling pin. Definitely recommend this recipe!

I read all of these awesome reviews so it might just be me but every time(3x) I make them, the dough is just crumbles...I keep making them because once I struggle with it and almost give up, I somehow make them and they taste great. Great, easy recipe! I added about a half teaspoon extra vanilla for flavor and they were delicious. They have a lovely buttery flavor. The cookies kept the form of the cookie cutters perfectly. Great go-to sugar cookie recipe!
I have searched for soft cookie that would hold its shape after being cut. These worked great. But I did follow tips in reviews for cutting back flour and time.
My neighbours and I loved them.
Yum!!!

Everyone raved about these - young and old!
These cookies are awful!!! Will never make them again!!
